intro: Echinomastus unguispinus subsp. laui, commonly known as the Laui's echinomastus, is a member of the Apocynaceae family. It is a succulent shrub characterized by its fleshy, spiny stems and leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. Due to its unique appearance and adaptations, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
